fields.summary: Object Storage: buckets landing page and bucket/folder contents pages

comments.body: Including navigation added to top_nav and dashboard.
[~jloza] should I create another issue for the dashboard icon?
[~dkavanagh] Sure, I can do it.
Going to investigate if we can use the AWS JavaScript SDK (http://aws.amazon.com/sdk-for-browser/) for the S3 GUI.

Ready for initial UX review at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/884

[~jloza]: See my comments in the PR description about the known issue.

Awesome start, [~kgill] (and [~dkavanagh])!

 ALL Buckets landing page: 
* table view, "View contents" action menu option should be sentence case, please
* Remove or comment out versioning-related stuff form aciton menus because that's not MVP, we may not get to it
* Object counts never resolve. Also, consider lazy loading here so if any resolve we will see those
* needs tabs implemented for bucket general info and tasks, can't update wireframe until confluence unhoses, but like we talked about on the phone please
* need icon display for buckets in list and tile please. If you need an icon for this let me know.  

SINGLE BUCKET VIEW landing page:
* nothing below the search box (i.e. page content) is displaying. This is taking way too long to load, against AWS. Screenshot attached.

[~jloza]: Fixed "View contents" case, removed versioning menu item, and pushed a few other fixes in https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/895addea028d1eff40771daf9c7d3228f85f759f

For the tabs, would those go on the "All buckets" landing page or on the single bucket contents page (or both)?

The bucket object counts are lazy-loaded and display fairly quickly for me on my AWS account
The bucket contents page also loads fairly quickly for me (using my AWS account).
Could you try again, and perhaps we can schedule a quick hangout if the problem persists?

[~jloza]: nm on the tabs question, I see they're implemented on both the landing page and the contents page in the wireframes.

I added icons to the buckets landing page and the tile view of the bucket contents pages in commit https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/2d55961738189b54b0dfc2f37dca158c957e6e3b
I selected the Foundation "paint-bucket" icon (from http://zurb.com/playground/foundation-icon-fonts-3) for the buckets landing page.  Let me know if that works.

[~jloza]: I figured out the issue loading the bucket contents on AWS, so you should be unblocked reviewing those pages now.  I notice the object counts still take a while to load, since some of the buckets have tens of thousands of items, and AWS doesn't have API calls for resource counts (yeah, go figure), so the only way to calculate resource counts (for buckets, instances, etc.) is to fetch the entire collection of items and count em.  If we still want to keep the object counts on the buckets landing page, I'll convert them to individual lazy-load fetches for each bucket.
Lazy load FTW!

[~jloza]: ok, I've converted the object count fetches to lazy-load via individual XHR fetches on the buckets landing page in commit https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/18434d2f3aec4ab8ebd8815e67bd9cb43d7033a6

Should I resubmit this for UX review, or do you want to wait until the Tasks tab is implemented?  I think we may need further discussion with Zach et.al. for the tasks, since we probably won't need to display the delete status (since those happen so fast), and multi-part upload isn't on the roadmap for the 4.1 console, right?
[~kgill], The http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/API/mpUploadListMPUpload.html api is something we should be able to use and that's available in boto, via the bucket object.
[~jloza]: Since MPU isn't on the roadmap for 4.1 AFAICT, and the tasks list can only pull MPU tasks via the API, could we shelve the Tasks tab for later to get this one reviewed asap?

[~kgill], I'm happy to review without tasks list, feel free to put this ticket in review and assign to me. Probably the thing to do here to move this ticket through is to create an additional story for implementing the tasks stuff. GUI-1237 created for that work.
Submitting to [~jloza] for UX review.

AWESOME! Small things:

ALL BUCKETS landing page:
* tile views do not have icons
* versioning column not in table view
* header in table view should read "CREATION TIME"  not date

SINGLE BUCKET LANDING PAGE:
* folder action menu items missing "View details"
* object action menu items missing everything but View contents and Delete
* folder should not display "Size" parameter in tile view, just "Last modified"
* folder does not appear to show last modified value
* tile view: "Size" hover text should be capitalized

[~jloza]: Fixed the remaining issues based on your feedback in https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/859453828cd922ac2e14fd84ced930c278e30cbe (note that it's on the GUI-1207 branch).

A few comments/questions
- Folders don't have a last_modified value, so we should remove that from the wireframe.
- The versioning info always seems to return Disabled, possibly due to a Boto bug, will continue to investigate.
- For an object, how do we plan to handle the "Open" menu item?
- Howe do we plan on handling the "Copy link to object" action?  Are we displaying a modal dialog with the link highlighted?

HI Kamal,

* Folders don't have a last_modified value, so we should remove that from the wireframe.
Will do. Thanks. 
* The versioning info always seems to return Disabled, possibly due to a Boto bug, will continue to investigate.
OK, thanks. We can always move that to a separate ticket if you'd like.
* For an object, how do we plan to handle the "Open" menu item?
That shouldn't be there, I'll remove it from the wireframe
* Howe do we plan on handling the "Copy link to object" action? Are we displaying a modal dialog with the link highlighted?
Just copy to clipboard. No dialog needed.

[~jloza]: Just a heads up on the copy to clipboard operation.  Browsers disabled the ability to copy text to the clipboard without user intervention years ago due to security concerns (see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/400212/how-to-copy-to-the-clipboard-in-javascript).  We may be able to leverage a Flash-based solution (e.g. http://zeroclipboard.org), but will need to investigate.  I suggest we move that action to phase 2 if possible.

[~jloza]: Another heads up, I finally got around to pulling in the bucket owner on the buckets landing page.  Since the get_all_buckets() fetch doesn't include ownership info, we need to issue a get_acl() API request *per bucket*, which significantly slows down the buckets landing page (we're talking by an order of magnitude here!).  Since the bucket details page displays ownership info, I suggest we hide the ownership column/key from the landing page for performance reasons.  Thoughts?

[~kgill] I don't know what you mean about disabling copy to clipboard. I literally just right clicked your link and used the "copy link address" option in chrome to do exactly that. 

If we have to we can just keep that functionality in the browser on the detail page where we just provide the link. This was just a nicety. 

For owner, can we lazy load that so we have the rest of the info handy while we load that? If not, we can move that to the detail page, but it would be great if we didn't have to.

[~jloza] Yeah, but your copy to clipboard operation required user intervention (via right-click).  I don't fully understand what happens when you click on the "copy link to object" menu item, but the link isn't displayed anywhere AFAICT, which would make the "highlight-then-right-click-to-copy" operation you mention a bit tricky, right?

For lazy-loading the ownership, we're already lazy-loading the object count, so doing both, although possible, would be tricky, and would bog down the back-end with the number and payload of API calls if the bucket list is fairly lengthy.
OK, we can get rid of the copy link thing and the owners on the landing page. It's a holiday weekend!
Submitting to you [~jloza] for a final UX check (use branch GUI-1207)

[~jloza]: One more heads up, I tested the load time of the buckets landing page and it appears to take about 1 sec *per bucket* to load when we fetch/display the versioning status of each bucket (since that fetch requires an extra API call per bucket).  Removing the versioning fetch loads the page in about 5 seconds with about 30 buckets.  The comparison is ignoring the object counts fetches.  So, like the owner column, we should strongly consider removing the versioning column from the buckets landing page and only display those on the bucket detail page.

[~dkavanagh]: Feel free to disregard looking in to the bucket versioning issue, as it seems to be working now.  I think I may have had an older boto version, but we're all good now w.r.t. displaying the versioning status on the buckets landing page and bucket detail page.

[~jloza]: Looks as though we'll need to keep the versioning status on the buckets landing page since the Enable/Suspend Versioning menu item requires it.  I noticed it loading much faster recently, so perhaps it was due to network issues on my end.  Sorry to raise any false alarms.
[~kgill], we should show versioning status on the landing page, we should not enable/suspend versioning until we can do all version management (show all versions at least), which is sprint 4.

Looking awesome!

* it takes upwards of 15 seconds for bucket tiles or table to load anything when viewing on AWS. This is way too slow. It may also be slow on Euca in a production environment in that case. 
* folder contents, table view: object names are not clickable
* folder contents, both views: KB in size should have both letters capitalized (as should MB and GB when those display, please double-check those while you're in there)

[~jloza]: As I mentioned in the comments above, the delayed load time of the buckets landing page is due to fetching the versioning status for each bucket.
For the folder contents view, 'kB' is the recommended notation for kilobytes.  See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kilobyte
I'm assuming the object names should direct to the object details page, correct?

Ah, because in this context we are using decimal instead of binary on the kB. OK. 

Yes, obj names should direct to obj detail pages. That's in the wireframe but may be easily missed.  

For bucket load, can we lazy load versioning status, or something? The load time is unacceptable.
Remaining issues fixed inhttps://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/960b6070ef741183c6e5ef34228c1a0cb20746ff (lazy-load versioning status and link objects to details page).
all looking good! Can you please switch out the dripping bucket for the one I sent you earlier today and then we are good to go!

[~jloza]: I've updated the buckets icon on the landing page -- feel free to take a look.  BTW, you may need to empty your browser cache to see the image since disabling cache isn't always adequate for SVG icon updates.  

Just a heads up that we won't be able to move this to QA yet since most of the latest GUI1206 fixes are on the GUI-1207 branch (which is still in progress).  We can move 1206 to QA after 1207 is merged, hopefully later this week.
UX review passed, ready for code review
I'll hold this here and assign to [~kgill]. I know this was merged and GUI-1207 has additional fixes so I assume this can be sent to QA once that is merged.
